content.text:
Here is my response formatted as requested:

<OUTPUT_TEXT>

# Answering Telephones and Directing Calls

1. Answer promptly within 2-3 rings
2. Use a professional greeting: "[Organization name], this is [your name]. How may I help you?"
3. Listen carefully to determine the caller's needs
4. Check staff availability using the phone system or scheduling software
5. Transfer calls using proper etiquette:
   - Inform the caller you'll transfer them
   - Provide the extension number in case of disconnection
   - Use warm transfer when possible (introduce caller to staff member)
6. Take detailed messages if staff are unavailable:
   - Caller's name, company, phone number
   - Reason for call
   - Best time to return call
   - Any urgent information
7. Handle basic inquiries yourself when appropriate
8. Maintain a calm, friendly demeanor at all times
9. End calls professionally: "Is there anything else I can assist you with?"
10. Document calls as needed in the office system

</OUTPUT_TEXT>
